application

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides verious utilitary functions related to logging mostly.
    Author:
    Jonathan Juursema & Peter Wessels.

    • Method Detail

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String type,
                       java.lang.String message)
        A general log method. Messages are displayed as follows: [type] message
        Parameters:
        type - The type of message. The developer is free to choose their own type.
        message - The message.

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.String message)
        A shorthand for log if no specific type is desired.
        Parameters:
        message -

      • println

        public static void println(java.lang.String message)
        Same as log, but can print to a seperate output.
        Parameters:
        message - The message.

      • print

        public static void print(java.lang.String message)
        Same as println.
        Parameters:
        message - The message.

      • log

        public static void log(java.lang.Exception e)
        The specified log function which logs exception message. The message is consist of the type of exception and the message of the Exception.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to be logged.

        Returns:

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(java.lang.String text)
        Reads an integer from the default input
        Parameters:
        text - question text
        Returns:
        entered number

      • readInt

        public static int readInt(java.lang.String text,
                          java.lang.String errorMessage)
        Reads an integer from the default input With an invalid input the question will be asked again
        Parameters:
        text - question
        errorMessage - error message for wrong input
        Returns:
        number

      • sortLeaderboard

        public static java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> sortLeaderboard(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> passedMap)
        Sorts a hashmap by the values and returns the sorted hashmap. Code by: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8119366/sorting-hashmap-by-values
        Parameters:
        passedMap - The hashmap to be sorted.
        Returns:
        The sorted hashmap.
